menu_desc: Tapsilog is a meal composed of Filipino beef jerky, garlic fried rice, and fried egg.
menu_ingredient:
1½ lb. beef tapa 
 4 cups sinangag (garlic fried rice) 
 4 pieces fried eggs (over easy) 
 Spiced vinegar (sinamak or pinakurat)
menu_procedure: Arrange 1 cup sinangag, a quarter of the beef tapa, and piece of fried egg in a plate. Serve with spiced vinegar and ketchup.

menu_ingredient:
3 pc Sliced Ham 
 1 pc Egg 
 1 cup Rice (cooked) 
 2 cloves Garlic (minced) 
 Cooking oil 
 Salt and pepper
menu_procedure: In a pan heat the oil then sauté garlic and rice. Add salt and pepper to taste. Afterwards, place the rice on a plate. Fry the sliced ham and place on the plate with the rice. Fry the egg sunny side up and add it to the plate. Serve with ketchup.

menu_ingredient:
2 pc hotdog 
 1 cup garlic rice 
 1 pc fried egg
menu_procedure: Heat cooking oil and fry the hotdogs, and once the slits frills out the hotdogs are done.

menu_ingredient:
1 pc Chicken leg and thigh(seasoned with salt & pepper and little soy sauce) 
 1 cup Garlic rice 
 1 pc Fried egg
menu_procedure: In a frying pan, deep fried chicken for 8-12 minutes or until cooked. Garlic rice – heal oil in a pan, place chopped garlic , a cup of cooked rice seasoned with salt in  a teflon pan, fry an egg on a low heat.

menu_desc: Bangsilog is another popular breakfast dish by most Filipinos which is a combination of Bang=bangus(milkfish), Si=sinangag(fried rice), log = itlog(fried egg). Boneless bangus should be marinated in vinegar, garlic and pepper then fried until golden brown. Serve with fried egg and fried rice.
menu_ingredient:
1 large-sized boneless milkfish(bangus), cut in half 
 2 cups leftover rice 
 2 raw eggs 
 4 gloves garlic, minced 
 salt and pepper to taste
  6 gloves garlic, pound
 1/2 cup vinegar
 1/4 teaspoon ground pepper
menu_procedure: Marinate milkfish in garlic, pepper and vinegar for at least 3 hours or overnight inside the fridge. In a pan, heat oil then fry sunny-side up egg until set. Drain and set aside. In a same pan, fry garlic until light brown. Add rice then season with salt. Keep stirring for 3 minutes or until well blended. Set aside. In a frying pan, heat oil then fry marinated milkfish for 5 minutes each side or until golden brown. Drain on paper towel. Arrange fried milkfish in a serving plate with fried egg and fried rice. Enjoy!
